1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Exit process.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Base.IO.Exit
6  ( progAndArgs,
7    hSetKoshuOutput,
8    currentEncodings,
9    exit, exitCode,
10    putSuccess, putSuccessLn,
11    putAbort, putAbortWith,
12    putFailure, putFailureLn,
13  ) where
14
15import qualified GHC.IO.Encoding               as Enc
16import qualified System.Environment            as Sys
17import qualified System.Exit                   as Exit
18import qualified System.IO                     as IO
19import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Prelude  as B
20
21
22-- | Program name and command-line arguments.
23--   This function removes carrige returns from the arguments.
24progAndArgs :: IO (String, [String])
25progAndArgs =
26    do hSetKoshuOutput B.stdout
27       prog <- Sys.getProgName
28       args <- Sys.getArgs
29       return (prog, deleteCr args)
30
31-- Delete carriage return from command line argument.
32deleteCr :: [String] -> [String]
33deleteCr = map (filter notCrChar) . filter notCrString where
34    notCrChar   = (/= '\r')
35    notCrString = (/= "\r")
36
37-- | Set I/O handle for Koshucode output.
38hSetKoshuOutput :: IO.Handle -> IO ()
39hSetKoshuOutput h =
40    do Enc.setLocaleEncoding Enc.utf8_bom
41       IO.hSetNewlineMode h koshuNewlineMode
42       IO.hSetEncoding h IO.utf8
43
44-- | CRLF input and CRLF output.
45koshuNewlineMode :: IO.NewlineMode
46koshuNewlineMode = IO.universalNewlineMode { IO.inputNL  = IO.CRLF
47                                           , IO.outputNL = IO.CRLF }
48
49-- | Encoding judgement string.
50currentEncodings :: IO String
51currentEncodings =
52    do locale  <- Enc.getLocaleEncoding
53       file    <- Enc.getFileSystemEncoding
54       return $ "|-- ENCODING  /content '" ++ show locale
55                         ++ "  /file '"    ++ show file
56
57
58-- --------------------------------------------  Exit
59
60-- | Exit process.
61exit :: Int -> IO a
62exit = B.exitWith . exitCode
63
64-- | Map integer value to exit code.
65exitCode :: Int -> Exit.ExitCode
66exitCode 0 = Exit.ExitSuccess
67exitCode n = Exit.ExitFailure n
68
69-- | Print message and exit on 0.
70putSuccess :: String -> IO a
71putSuccess msg = success $ putStr msg
72
73putSuccessLn :: String -> IO a
74putSuccessLn msg = success $ putStrLn msg
75
76-- | Print abort message and exit on 1.
77--
78--   >>> putAbort
79--   ABORT / <interactive> exits on 1
80
81putAbort :: IO a
82putAbort =
83    do prog <- Sys.getProgName
84       putFailureLn $ "ABORT / " ++ prog ++ " exits on 1"
85
86-- | Print error and abort message and exit on 1.
87putAbortWith :: String -> IO a
88putAbortWith msg =
89    do IO.hPutStrLn IO.stderr msg
90       putAbort
91
92-- | Print error message and exit on 1.
93putFailure :: String -> IO a
94putFailure msg = failure $ IO.hPutStr IO.stderr msg
95
96putFailureLn :: String -> IO a
97putFailureLn msg = failure $ IO.hPutStrLn IO.stderr msg
98
99success :: IO () -> IO a
100success body = body >> exit 0
101
102failure :: IO () -> IO a
103failure body = body >> exit 1
104
